required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate Methods That Assess the Effect of AZD4017 in Adipose Tissue
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised, Single-blind, Placebo-controlled, Single-centre, Phase I Study in Abdominally Obese Healthy Volunteers to Evaluate Methods to Assess 11-βHSD1 Activity in Adipose Tissue and Related Downstream Biomarkers After Single and Repeated Oral Doses of AZD4017 for 10 Days

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this study is to investigate different methods to evaluate the effect of AZD4017 in adipose tissue after single and multiple doses of AZD4017 in abdominally obese but otherwise healthy subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: To investigate the effect of single and repeated doses of AZD4017 and placebo on mechanisms in adipose tissue involved in metabolic regulation
primary_outcome.time_frame: A adipose tissue biospy is taken at baseline, on first day of dosing day, on 4th dosing day and on 9th dosing day.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety and Tolerability (Adverse events, vital signs, ECGs, physical examination, laboratory variables
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The variables will be measure predose and the repeatedly during the following 10 days after dosing

intervention.description: oral suspension, 1200mg, once daily, for 10 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Provision of signed written and dated informed consent
- Have a body mass index (BMI) between 27 and 35 kg/m2
- Waist circumference of >102 cm
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of any clinical significant disease
- Any clinically significant illness, medical/surgical procedure or trauma within 4 weeks of the first administration of investigational product
- Any clinically significant abnormalities in clinical chemistry, haematology or urinalysis results as judged by the investigator

overall_official.last_name: Per-Anders Jansson, Ass Prof, MD, PhD
overall_official.affiliation: Avdelningen för molekylär och klinisk medicin Lundberglaboratoriet
